00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Data class
00017 
00018 #ifndef __DATA_HPP
00019 #define __DATA_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <memory.hpp>
00022 #include <types.hpp>
00023 #include <tuple.hpp>
00024 #include <address.hpp>
00025 #include <stack.hpp>
00026 
00027 /// The main data type of the VM.
00028 /**
00029  * It can hold
00030  * \li a Number;
00031  * \li a Tuple;
00032  * \li an Address; or
00033  * \li nothing at all (ie. 'undefined' or 'not set').
00034  */
00035 class Data {
00036     
00037     public:
00038         /// The type of a Data object.
00039         enum Type {
00040             Type_undefined,
00041             Type_number,
00042             Type_tuple,
00043             Type_address
00044         };
00045         
00046     protected:
00047         
00048         // The value_type specifies how the value should be interpreted.
00049         Type value_type;
00050         
00051         // The value can contain a Number, a Tuple or an Address.
00052         // Because some of these types have non-trivial constructors, the union does not (and can not) contain members of these types.
00053         // So, instead, it only contains members of the same size as the types it should be able to contain.
00054         // A reinterpret_cast should be used to interface the value as a specific type.
00055         // Please note that we have to take care of calling constructors and deconstructors ourselves.
00056         union Value {
00057             Alignment alignment;
00058             char  number_data[sizeof(Number )];
00059             char   tuple_data[sizeof(Tuple  )];
00060             char address_data[sizeof(Address)];
00061         } value;
00062         
00063     public:
00064         
00065         inline Data(                       ) : value_type(Type_undefined) {                                } ///< Get a Data object representing 'undefined' (ie. 'not set').
00066         inline Data(Number  const & number ) : value_type(Type_number   ) { new (&value) Number (number ); } ///< Get a Data object containing a Number.
00067         inline Data(Tuple   const & tuple  ) : value_type(Type_tuple    ) { new (&value) Tuple  (tuple  ); } ///< Get a Data object containing a Tuple.
00068         inline Data(Address const & address) : value_type(Type_address  ) { new (&value) Address(address); } ///< Get a Data object containing an Address.
00069         
00070         /// Copy a Data object.
00071         inline Data & operator = (Data const & data) {
00072             reset();
00073             switch(data.type()){
00074                 case Type_undefined: reset();                 break;
00075                 case Type_number   : reset(data.asNumber ()); break;
00076                 case Type_tuple    : reset(data.asTuple  ()); break;
00077                 case Type_address  : reset(data.asAddress()); break;
00078             }
00079             return *this;
00080         }
00081         
00082         /// Get a copy of a Data object.
00083         inline Data(Data const & data) : value_type(Type_undefined) {
00084             *this = data;
00085         }
00086         
00087         /// Check whether the value is set (true) or not (false).
00088         inline bool isSet() const {
00089             return value_type != Type_undefined;
00090         }
00091         
00092         /// Get the Type of value stored.
00093         inline Type type() const {
00094             return value_type;
00095         }
00096         
00097         inline Number        & asNumber ()       { return *reinterpret_cast<      Number  *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as a Number.
00098         inline Number  const & asNumber () const { return *reinterpret_cast<const Number  *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as a Number.
00099         
00100         inline Tuple         & asTuple  ()       { return *reinterpret_cast<      Tuple   *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as a Tuple.
00101         inline Tuple   const & asTuple  () const { return *reinterpret_cast<const Tuple   *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as a Tuple.
00102         
00103         inline Address       & asAddress()       { return *reinterpret_cast<      Address *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as an Address.
00104         inline Address const & asAddress() const { return *reinterpret_cast<const Address *>(&value); } ///< Interpret this Data object as an Address.
00105         
00106         /// Reset the value to 'undefined' (ie. 'not set').
00107         inline void reset() {
00108             switch(value_type){
00109                 case Type_undefined:                 break;
00110                 case Type_number   : resetNumber (); break;
00111                 case Type_tuple    : resetTuple  (); break;
00112                 case Type_address  : resetAddress(); break;
00113             }
00114         }
00115         
00116         inline void reset(Number  const & number ) { reset(); value_type = Type_number ; new (&value) Number (number ); } ///< Set the value to a Number.
00117         inline void reset(Tuple   const & tuple  ) { reset(); value_type = Type_tuple  ; new (&value) Tuple  (tuple  ); } ///< Set the value to a Tuple.
00118         inline void reset(Address const & address) { reset(); value_type = Type_address; new (&value) Address(address); } ///< Set the value to an Address.
00119         
00120         /// Make a 'real' copy of the data.
00121         /**
00122          * This will copy the contents of a Tuple, instead of sharing them.
00123          * 
00124          * \see Shared
00125          */
00126         inline Data copy() const {
00127             if (value_type == Type_tuple) return Data(asTuple().copy());
00128             return *this;
00129         }
00130         
00131         /// Deconstruct the data.
00132         inline ~Data() {
00133             reset();
00134         }
00135         
00136     protected:
00137         inline void resetNumber () { asNumber ().~Number (); value_type = Type_undefined; }
00138         inline void resetTuple  () { asTuple  ().~Tuple  (); value_type = Type_undefined; }
00139         inline void resetAddress() { asAddress().~Address(); value_type = Type_undefined; }
00140         
00141         friend class Stack<Data>;
00142         
00143 };
00144 
00145 template<>
00146 class Stack<Data> : public BasicStack<Data> {
00147     
00148     public:
00149         inline explicit Stack(Size capacity = 0) : BasicStack<Data>(capacity) {}
00150         
00151         inline Number  popNumber () { Number  element = (*--top).asNumber (); top->resetNumber (); return element; }
00152         inline Tuple   popTuple  () { Tuple   element = (*--top).asTuple  (); top->resetTuple  (); return element; }
00153         inline Address popAddress() { Address element = (*--top).asAddress(); top->resetAddress(); return element; }
00154         
00155 };
00156 
00157 #endif
